item.title: Want A Bunch Of Free eShop Games This Holiday Season? Here's How
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

If you want to get your hands on nearly a dozen free Switch games this holiday season, now's your chance. Starting today, No Gravity Games is giving away one Switch title per day through December 19, on which day there will be three free games. However, there is a catch that works out in your favor.

To claim a free game on Switch, players need to have claimed the previous day's title and maintained it in their library. You must also have at least one No Gravity title prior to claiming the first freebie, but there's a trick you can use to get that for free, too. Just visit No Gravity Games' official site and sign up for the newsletter, and you'll receive a free game. If you do this first, it will count as a "purchased" game from No Gravity and you're able to then claim the other games for free.

If players do miss a day, they can rejoin the giveaway chain by purchasing the previous day's game, which will be available at a greatly reduced price. Each title becomes available for free at midnight PT and they will be available to claim on Nintendo's eShop until 11:59pm PT on the same day.

While most of the free games are currently unrevealed, the first one is Bullets & Brains, a top-down arcade-style 3D shooter that pits players against an endless army of the living dead. Wreckin' Ball Adventure, Creepy Tale, Alder's Blood, and Destropolis are all glimpsed in the Switchmas Giveaway trailer above, but not yet confirmed as titles for this year's giveaway.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Fortnite's Harry Potter Collab Revealed, Lets You Dress Up Like A Wizard
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

By on December 12, 2025 at 12:28PM PST

Epic Games has announced the latest major collab in Fortnite, and it's Harry Potter. Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment and Epic are bringing "the world of Harry Potter" to Epic's platform this month, including Fortnite and Rocket League.

The Fortnite Shop will be updated later this month with outfits and accessories based on all things Harry Potter and the wider wizarding world. The outfits can be tailored to specific houses, including Gryffindor, Slytherin, Ravenclaw, and Hufflepuff.

In Rocket League, the game's Frosty Fest event will include a new Hogwarts House Rivalry event, during which players can earn points for their specific Hogwarts house. There will be Harry Potter-themed in-game shop items, too, and Epic said it will reveal them later this month.

Additionally, Hogwarts Legacy is now free on the Epic Games Store through December 18. People who play the game for at least two hours by December 18 will get the Chocolate Frog back bling for Fortnite.

While fans wait for the Harry Potter content to come to Fortnite and Rocket League, the newest Fortnite update coming on December 13 will add Kim Kardashian as a playable character. She is a big fan of Fortnite and worked closely with the developers on the collab.

In other news, Fortnite OG Season 7 is now live.

Although JK Rowling, who has made transphobic remarks, is not personally involved with this new Fortnite and Rocket League content, she stands to profit from its success. For more, read our in-depth article on how Rowling's comments have impacted the trans community. In this article, you will also find links to trans creators you can support, as well as charities you can donate to.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/fortnites-harry-potter-collab-revealed-lets-you-dress-up-like-a-wizard/1100-6536950/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: Activision Calls Season 1 CoD: Warzone's "Cleanest In History" For Anti-Cheat Efforts
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 has integrated with Warzone for Season 1, bringing a new Resurgence map, perk changes, and now less hackers to the battle royale. A new post from Activision cites Black Ops 7 Season 1 as being the "cleanest" Warzone launch in history.

The publisher says Call of Duty Season 1 launched with the strongest anti-cheat performance Warzone has ever had, and the majority of players are completing their matches without encountering any cheaters.

üõ°Ô∏è Call of Duty: #BlackOps7 | Call of Duty: #Warzone
A message from #TeamRICOCHET:
Season 01 launched with the strongest anti-cheat performance Warzone has ever had. The vast majority of players are completing their matches without encountering a single cheater. This our‚Ä¶

‚Äî Call of Duty Updates (@CODUpdates) December 12, 2025

"This our cleanest Warzone launch in Call of Duty history," Activision says.

In past years, Call of Duty's Ricochet anti-cheat has struggled to keep hackers out of the game, but the team made a few upgrades for the launch of Season 1. The publisher recently outlined Ricochet's major changes, including improved aimbot-detection models and more advanced behavioral detection to stop cheaters early.

Activision says this success is also aided by Call of Duty's new TPM 2.0 and Secure Boot requirement on PC, which is implemented for both Black Ops 7 and Warzone.

Of course, the battle against cheaters seems never-ending, but the publisher says it remains committed to keeping the bad apples out of the game.

"We'll keep evolving our defenses, disrupting cheat providers, and protecting fair play so you can stay focused on your matches," Activision says.

Sales for Black Ops 7 have faltered compared to previous years, and the publisher has announced a major strategic shift for the Call of Duty series. Despite the changes to come, a Call of Duty movie series is still in the works at Paramount.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: New Tomb Raider Games Recast Lara Croft With A Gaming Veteran
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The new Tomb Raider games announced at The Game Awards, Tomb Raider: Legacy of Atlantis and Tomb Raider: Catalyst, will feature the voice of Alix Wilton Regan as Lara Croft.

This is a change from the latest trilogy--Tomb Raider, Rise of the Tomb Raider, and Shadow of the Tomb Raider--which featured Camilla Luddington voicing and performing the motion-capture for Croft.

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: Tomb Raider: Catalyst Teaser Trailer

Wilton Regan is known for her roles as Samantha Traynor in Mass Effect 3 and the female Inquisitor in Dragon Age: Inquisition. She also played Aya in Assassin's Creed Origins.

Legacy of Atlantis is a remake of the original Tomb Raider game featuring "modern visuals, updated gameplay design, and expanded storytelling." Catalyst, meanwhile, is a brand-new entry in the series, developed using the Unreal Engine 5, and claiming to be the "most expansive entry yet."

Legacy of Atlantis is set for release in 2026, with Catalyst coming in 2027. Both games are coming to PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and Steam. There is no word yet on Switch 2.

Outside of the world of video games, Prime Video is making a new live-action Tomb Raider TV show starring Sophie Turner as Lara Croft and Sigourney Weaver as Wallace.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Save On Many Of 2025's Best PC Games During Fanatical's Winter Sale
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Winter doesn't technically arrive until December 21, but Fanatical is getting a jump on the season with its Winter Sale 2025. Like all sales at the retailer, you'll find hundreds of PC games available for cheap--almost all of which are offered as Steam keys. Some high-profile titles are on sale, including some of 2025's best like Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 and Elden Ring: Nightreign, as well as discounts for upcoming titles like Crimson Desert and Resident Evil Requiem. Along with the discounts, customers can also unlock a free Winter Bonus Drop when spending over $15 on a single order. This could be anything from a free game to a discount coupon.

If you happened to miss The Game Awards, all you really need to know is that Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 walked away with pretty much every trophy. And if you still haven't jumped into the story-rich RPG, you can pick it up for just $36 (was $50). No doubt it's an iconic game, and we'd contend it's worth purchasing even at full price--it was GameSpot's Game of the Year, after all. So at $36, it's hard to pass up. Along with a memorable cast of characters and a fantastic story, its tense, turn-based combat offers plenty of flexibility thanks to some real-time mechanics and dozens of ways to customize your party.

Kingdom Come: Deliverance II was also at The Game Awards, and right now you can add it to your Steam library for $36 (was $60). It's a remarkable improvement over the original, and it's a sprawling open-world action RPG that gives you good reason to stay inside during the winter. A similar open-world RPG option that's a bit cheaper is Dragon's Dogma 2, as it's $25.19 (was $70). It doesn't have a traditional fast travel system, but that only means you'll have more time to wander its gigantic open world overflowing with dynamic encounters and side-quests.

Those waiting for GTA VI can bide their time with Saints Row: Gold Edition, which is a mere $6 (was $40). The off-the-wall crime game isn't quite as well-regarded as the GTA series, but at just $6, it's a solid choice to keep you busy with building a crime empire, kitting out supercars, and blasting your way through hordes of enemies as you take over the sandy city of Santo Ileso.

Plenty of other great titles are included in Fanatical's Winter Sale 2025, and you'll find a few of our favorites below.

Fanatical Winter Sale 2025

  • Age of Empires II: Definitive Edition -- $10.49 ($35)

item.title: The Last of Us' Bruce Straley Shares More Details About Why He Left Naughty Dog
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

From 1999 to 2017, Bruce Straley was one of the key players at Naughty Dog, and the co-director of two its best-selling games, The Last of Us and Uncharted 4. However, Straley essentially left the game industry for several years despite that impressive track record. Now, Straley is sharing more details regarding his departure, following up on comments he made years ago.

"I had been there 18 years. That's a long time for anybody to be anywhere," Straley told Polygon. "I need new problems to solve, I need new creative outlets. I'm not saying there wouldn't be opportunities there, but couple that feeling with the idea that I was working really, really hard at something that wasn‚Äôt mine."

Straley went on to explain that he didn't jump to another AAA studio because he felt Naughty Dog was the "pinnacle" of developers that made the games he was interested in. And he didn't want to deal with "a whole different bureaucratic or cultural system."

"It really comes down to: Do you want to continue working for someone else and put in all the effort to build an IP, to build characters, to build things that a franchise could be built out of? I got paid very well there," added Straley. "I got some appreciation there, but it felt like it was time to break out and try it on my own. It felt like it was time to evolve my concepts and build a new team. It might fail miserably, but I thought that it was at least my failure based on my choice."

During The Game Awards, Straley's new team at Wildflower Interactive debuted their inaugural title, Coven of the Chicken Foot. It's a wordless single-player adventure that's completely unlike the games Straley made at Naughty Dog. Players assume control of a witch named Gertie and her creature companion as they try to fulfill her oath. The game doesn't currently have a release date.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
